document.heading: Residency Requirement Reinstatement Amendment Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-138, the “Residency Requirement Reinstatement Amendment Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-137, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 17, 1998, and April 7, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 22, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-340 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-138 became effective on July 24, 1998.
